data.title: Voice First AI: Automate the Ordinary, Pursue the Extraordinary
data.snippet:
In this podcast, Michael Pierce discusses the potential of AI to take over routine coordination, planning, and oversight tasks in businesses. He suggests that AI can handle workflows, delegate tasks, track performance metrics, and even assist in decision-making, acting as a tireless and efficient assistant. He notes that AI's ability to automate repetitive tasks can free human employees to focus on more creative and strategic tasks. Furthermore, human manager roles are not becoming obsolete but rather evolving to oversight and strategic roles, indicating a shift towards more fulfilling work. Despite the benefits, Michael highlights the importance of closely monitoring AI to prevent negative outcomes that could emerge from over-automation. He also believes small teams can greatly benefit [...] In this episode of Voice First AI, host Michael Pierce discusses the latest advancement in artificial intelligence ‚Äì GPT-5.2. The discussion centers around how this new version of AI will change the game by displaying improved reasoning, faster responses, long-context memory, better understanding of voice and images, and more autonomous behavior. While it is a promising development for small businesses, it will also have a significant impact on the search industry. Ethical considerations and implications related to AI applications also make an important part of the conversation. The episode concludes with a comprehensive checklist to help listeners prepare for the GPT-5.2 update and a final thought on the importance of adaptability in the rapidly advancing landscape of AI technology. data.title: Notes - Pierce Freeman
data.snippet:
# Notes

I write about what I've built and what I've broken. These are the longer pieces where I work through technical problems, document systems I've shipped, and reflect on the lessons that stick around after the debugger closes.

## Starting a podcast in 2025

Starting a new podcast can feel late, but market timing matters less than making something meaningfully different.

## Being late but still being early

Living in San Francisco makes you feel late to every trend because your reference group is distorted.

## Automating our home video imports

Digitizing decades of family videos from MiniDV and Hi8 tapes at lossless quality using dvrescue and FireWire for ~$300 instead of $4k.

## Adding my parents to tailscale [...] ## Adding my parents to tailscale

Setting up secure remote access to a home media server for family members using Tailscale's VPN and ACL permissions.

## A deep dive on agent sandboxes

How modern coding agents use OS-level sandboxing with macOS Seatbelt and Linux Landlock to balance powerful tool access with security.

## Language servers for AI

Why language servers are becoming more important for AI coding agents than for human developers as deterministic validators in correction loops.

## My simple home podcast studio

Building a home podcast studio from scratch with professional audio, 4K video recording, and remote guest capabilities for under $1k.

## We need centralized infrastructure [...] ## Falling for Kubernetes

I default to bare metal where I can. But recently I had to adopt a more complicated server management solution. And after a couple months of building for kubernetes, I must admit I'm falling for it more every day.

## Content that I'm obsessed with

A constantly updating collection of content that I highly recommend to others. Movies, TV, and Books. Updated occasionally if something has staying power of more than 3 months.
